dta.Demand¶

class dta.Demand(net, vehClassName, startTime, endTime, timeStep)¶

Bases: object

Class that represents the demand matrix for a Network

__init__(net, vehClassName, startTime, endTime, timeStep)¶

Constructor that initializes an empty Demand table that has three dimensions: time, origin taz, destination taz.

net is a dta.Network instance vehClassName is a string startTime, endTime and timeStep are dta.Utils.Time instancess

Methods

__init__ x.__init__(...) initializes x; see x.__class__.__doc__ for signature
Demand.applyTimeOfDayFactors
Demand.getNumSlices
Demand.getTotalNumTrips
Demand.getValue
Demand.iterTimePeriods
Demand.readCubeODTable
Demand.readDynameqTable
Demand.removeInvalidODPairs
Demand.setValue
Demand.writeDynameqTable
applyTimeOfDayFactors(factorsInAList)¶

Apply the given time of day factors to the existing demand object and return a new demand object with as many time slices as the number of factors. Each time slice is the result of the original table multiplied by a factor in the list.

getNumSlices()¶

Return the number of time slices the demand has been split

getTotalNumTrips()¶

Return the total number of trips for all time periods

getValue(timeLabel, origin, destination)¶

Return the value of the given time period, origin, and destination

iterTimePeriods()¶

Return an iterator to the time periods associated with the demand time slices

classmethod readCubeODTable(fileName, net, vehicleClassName, startTime, endTime)¶

Reads the demand (linear format) from the input csv file. The fieldNames should correspond to the names of the vehicle classes.

classmethod readDynameqTable(net, fileName)¶

Read the dynameq demand stored in the fileName that pertains to the dynameq network a :py:class:`DynameqNetwork`instance

removeInvalidODPairs()¶

Examine all the OD interchanges and remove those for which a path does not exist from origin to destination

setValue(timeLabel, origin, destination, value)¶

Set the value of the given timeLabel, origin, and destination

writeDynameqTable(fileName)¶

Write the demand in the dynameq format
